title: Hybrid cars use kinetic energy to supplement gas

content.question: Which of the following is a reason why hybrid electric vehicles use less fossil fuel per mile traveled than a typical internal combustion engine vehicle uses?

choices.label: Hybrid electric vehicles donâ€™t burn fossil fuels; they run on electric energy.
Hybrid electric vehicles are powered by the Sun using rooftop photovoltaic panels.
When the brakes are applied in hybrid electric vehicles, kinetic energy is converted into electric energy to charge the batteries that assist the electric motor.
Batteries in hybrid electric vehicles can be charged in the driveway overnight, when rates for electricity usage are typically low.
The engines in hybrid electric vehicles are powered by biofuels made from genetically modified corn.

content.answer: When the brakes are applied in hybrid electric vehicles, kinetic energy is converted into electric energy to charge the batteries that assist the electric motor.
